messages.text: One month later, Martha and Caroline are bundled in their winter coats on a walk around the lake.
Listen, I ran into Juan at Spoonful againâ€¦
Ugh! Why do you have to keep going there?!
Hey now â€” you know Spoonful is my favorite cafÃ©.
Iâ€™m not giving it up because your puppy-dog ex-boyfriend keeps trying to get back together with you.
Oh my God! He is NOT my ex-boyfriend. We were never even dating.
Martha, come on. Youâ€™re really only kidding yourself right now.
You obviously mattered a lot to him.
And I know you â€” so I know that he mattered to you too.
Keeping her hands in her pockets, Caroline nudges Martha with her elbow.
Go on. Text him.
No way. I told him I wouldnâ€™t speak to him again, and I always keep my promises.
Martha, thatâ€™s a dumb excuse and you know it.
I think youâ€™re AFRAID to text him.
Afraid? What would I be afraid of?
Caroline crosses her arms in jest.
You tell me.
Then her arms fall to her sides.
Seriously. You know that you can tell me.
Anything.
Marthaâ€™s shoulders visibly slump.
I know. Itâ€™s justâ€¦
I donâ€™t know how much longer I can do this to myself.
Just being paralyzed is difficult enough.
I mean, if I could choose between the paralyzed me and the old me, Iâ€™d choose the old me, every single day.
How can I expect someone to choose this me?
Marthaâ€™s voice cracks, and then she lets herself do something she NEVER does.
In front of Caroline, she starts to cry.
Why would anyone want to be with me when I donâ€™t even like myself?
Oh, Martha. I had no idea you felt like that.
Caroline bends down and wraps Martha in a hug. They stay like that for a while.
Then Caroline pulls back.
Martha, you are one of the strongest people I know.
Ugh, Iâ€”
I know. I know that you hate being called strong â€” but honestly, I donâ€™t give a damn right now.
Because you need to hear this.
You are SO strong.
You canâ€™t move your LEGS, Martha. And in the whole time youâ€™ve been living this nightmareâ€¦
Iâ€™ve never seen you cry. Not once. You never let it get you down.
But I complain all the time! And Iâ€™m dramaticâ€”
Yeah, but complaining and being dramatic â€” itâ€™s just your way of venting.
You make jokes and laugh about what you go through. Itâ€™s how you cope.
And itâ€¦it makes it easy to be your friend.
Youâ€™re the one who makes friendship easy, Caroâ€”
Martha? Will you just shut up and take the compliment?
Haha, okay. Thanks, Caroline.
Youâ€™re welcome. And now â€” will you shut up and text Juan?
He really wants to see you. He said that he realizes he made a mistake by forcing you to rock climb.
That he should have checked with you in the first place.
Ugh, fine. Iâ€™ll text him for you.
Haha, suuuure â€” Iâ€™ll let you pretend youâ€™re texting him for me.
Martha juts out her jaw, giving Caroline her best glare before the two women break out in smiles.
Then Martha texts Juan.
Heyâ€¦so I hear youâ€™ve been stalking Caroline at Spoonful recently ðŸ˜‰ That seems awfully serious of you.
Martha??!
Didnâ€™t I tell you I was going to be serious? Iâ€™m still trying to win over your heart, you know.
Well lucky for you, Iâ€™m willing to give you one more chance.
Oh really??
Yes. Meet me at the reflecting pool in Veterans Garden in Balboa park on Saturday at 3pm?
I see what youâ€™re doing there -- honoring my family roots?
Something like that.
Plus, I might have an adventure up my sleeveâ€¦
On Saturday, Martha waits at the reflecting pool in Veterans Garden.
She glances down at her watch when she sees Juanâ€™s muscular figure walking toward her.
Heâ€™s ten minutes early. She smiles to herself.
You rushed to get here, huh?
Well, yeah. Only an idiot would be late to a date with you.
Martha feels the familiar blush spread across her cheeks. Somehow, Juanâ€™s words always seem to have that effect on her.
Listen, Marthaâ€¦
No. Itâ€™s okay. You have nothing to explain.
I completely freaked out at the Sports Piers.
Yeah, well the only reason you freaked out was because I put you in that position in the first place.
And Iâ€™m sorry.
I forgive you. And Iâ€™M sorry I didnâ€™t give you the chance to apologize in the first place.
I didnâ€™t give you much of a chance at all, huh?
Sure you did. You swiped right on me, didnâ€™t you?
Haha yeah. But I want to do something even MORE special for you.
Oh yeah?
Yeah. My cousin Lillianâ€¦she owns a hot air balloon business. And sheâ€™s bringing one of the balloons to the park for us.
Juan transforms into a labradoodle puppy and Martha feels her heart melt.
WHAT??!
Iâ€™ve never been in a hot air balloon before â€” this is AMAZING!!
I was hoping you would think so.
Martha, Iâ€™m spending the day with you. Of course I think everythingâ€™s amazing.
Juan puts his hands on the arms of Marthaâ€™s chair â€” one of her favorite places for them â€”and he leans toward her.
The tension is so delicious and thick Martha can feel it around her, pressing into every pore in her skin.
Suddenly, a voice interrupts them.
All right, you two! Letâ€™s take a ride in my balloon. I have other appointments today, you know.
Martha laughs, and Juan joins in with her. After slipping an arm under her knees and wrapping the other one around her backâ€¦
He lifts and carries her over to the hot air balloon.
He and Lillian get her situated on a seat inside the woven basket,
And then Lillian pulls in the ropes and feeds the balloon more fireâ€¦
Until theyâ€™re gently sailing through the clear blue sky. The view of Balboa Park is breathtaking.
Juanâ€™s voice eases into the silence.
Martha?
Can we talk about what happened at the Sports Piers â€” just one more time?
Haha, do we really have to?
Yeah. Because I want to make sure weâ€™re on the same page about something.
Itâ€™s just, I have a lot to learn â€” about your paralysis, but also about the person you are, Martha.
And I want to learn everything.
Juanâ€¦
Iâ€™m serious. I want to KEEP learning those things about you.
Iâ€™m not looking for a temporary thing â€” this isnâ€™t some story I want to tell people.
Iâ€™m looking for something thatâ€™s gonna last forever.
Thatâ€™s a serious thing to say.
But I mean it â€” I want you to be my girlfriend.
I mean, will you?
Will you be my girlfriend? Please?
Of course Iâ€™ll be your girlfriend.
Oh, thank God. I really like you, Martha.
You fill me with potential energy.
I mean, look at what weâ€™re doing now â€” I can feel the energy coming out of every part of meâ€¦
my eyes, my fingertips â€” my mouth.
Martha raises an eyebrow.
Your mouth?
Haha, yes! My mouth. Come here, let me show you â€”
Juan waits a beat before he tastes Marthaâ€™s lips.
The flavor of their kiss is freshly ground coffee beans and cinnamonâ€¦
And it sends a strong current of potential energy surging through themâ€¦
One theyâ€™ve never felt before.
